revised_title: John Stanley Plaskett: A Pioneering Astronomer and Telescope Designer
tldr: John Stanley Plaskett was a renowned astronomer and telescope designer who made significant contributions to the field of astrophysics. He played a crucial role in the establishment of the Dominion Observatory in Ottawa and the design of its 72-inch reflecting telescope, which was the largest in the world at the time. Plaskett's work on radial velocities of stars, spectroscopic orbits, and the rotation of our galactic system solidified his international reputation and influenced the design of large reflecting telescopes for years to come.
